note: Includes turbine agitator and heat-transfer jacket, pressures to 300 psig

note: Includes turbine agitator and heat-transfer jacket, pressures to 300 psig

name: Tray, sieve

name: Crystallizer, continuous cooling, jacketed scraped wall
Dryer, steam-tube 1.0 m diameter, 21-58 m2 (Perry's)
note: Overall diameter 0.965 m, containing 14 tubes of 114 mm diameter. Information from Swenson Process Equipment as reproduced in Perry's 8th ed. Scaling is done by increasing length (e.g.for diameter = 0.965 m and length = 4.572 m, tube surface area = 21.4 m2, while for diameter = 0.965 m and length = 9.144 m, tube surface area = 44.6 m2).

name: Dryer, steam-tube 1.4 m diameter, 58-135 m2  (Perry's)
note: Overall diameter 1.372 m, containing 18 tubes of 114 mm diameter and 18 tubes of 63.5 mm diameter. Information from Swenson Process Equipment as reproduced in Perry's 8th ed. Scaling is done by increasing length (e.g.for diameter = 0.965 m and length = 4.572 m, tube surface area = 21.4 m2, while for diameter = 0.965 m and length = 9.144 m, tube surface area = 44.6 m2).

name: Dryer, steam-tube 1.8 m diameter, 118-350 m2  (Perry's)
note: Overall diameter 1.829 m, containing 27 tubes of 114 mm diameter and 27 tubes of 76.2 mm diameter. Information from Swenson Process Equipment as reproduced in Perry's 8th ed. Scaling is done by increasing length (e.g.for diameter = 0.965 m and length = 4.572 m, tube surface area = 21.4 m2, while for diameter = 0.965 m and length = 9.144 m, tube surface area = 44.6 m2).

name: Dryer, steam-tube 2.4 m diameter, 350-1200 m2  (Perry's)
note: Overall diameter 2.438 m, containing 90 tubes of 114 mm diameter. Information from Swenson Process Equipment as reproduced in Perry's 8th ed. Scaling is done by increasing length (e.g.for diameter = 0.965 m and length = 4.572 m, tube surface area = 21.4 m2, while for diameter = 0.965 m and length = 9.144 m, tube surface area = 44.6 m2). Values above 800 m2 exceed the range provided by Swenson, assuming length can be extended to ~37 m, and should be considered tentative. Override the upper limit, if desired, by setting "S upper" in the Equipment Library to 800. This will restrict available sizes to those provided by Swenson.

size_unit: Weight of shell and two heads, lb
name: Pressure vessel, horizontal (requires platforms)
note: Refers to a largely empty vessel; includes nozzles, manholes, and supports; estimate weight of shell and two 2:1 elliptical heads = [pi*((inner diameter, inches) + (shell thickness, inches))*((tangent to tangent length / length of cylindrical section, inches) + 0.8*(inner diameter, inches))*(shell thickness, inches)*(0.284 lb/in^3 {steel density})]

size_unit: Weight of shell and two heads, lb
name: Pressure vessel, vertical (requires platforms)
note: Refers to a largely empty vessel; includes nozzles, manholes, and supports; estimate weight of shell and two 2:1 elliptical heads = [pi*((inner diameter, inches) + (shell thickness, inches))*((tangent to tangent length / length of cylindrical section, inches) + 0.8*(inner diameter, inches))*(shell thickness, inches)*(0.284 lb/in^3 {steel density})]

size_unit: Weight of shell and two heads, lb
name: Vertical tower (requires platforms)
note: Refers to a vessel designed for plates and/or packing; includes nozzles, manholes, a skirt, and internals for multiple feed locations and management of bottoms but not plates or packing; estimate weight of shell and two 2:1 elliptical heads = [pi*((inner diameter, inches) + (shell thickness, inches))*((tangent to tangent length / length of cylindrical section, inches) + 0.8*(inner diameter, inches))*(shell thickness, inches)*(0.284 lb/in^3 {steel density})]

name: Platforms and ladders for horizontal pressure vessel

name: Platforms and ladders for vertical tower
note: Use vessel inner diameter (ID), 3–24 ft and tangent-to-tangent length (the length of the cylindrical section of the vessel), 27–170 ft

name: Pump, centrifugal, 1 stage, 1800 rpm, VSC
note: Includes drive but not motor; flow rate 50–3500 gpm, pump head 50–200 ft, max motor power 200 hp

name: Pump, centrifugal, 1 stage, 3600 rpm, HSC
note: Includes drive but not motor; flow rate 100–1500 gpm, pump head 100–450 ft, max motor power 150 hp

name: Pump, centrifugal, 1 stage, 1800 rpm, HSC
note: Includes drive but not motor; flow rate 250–5000 gpm, pump head 50–500 ft, max motor power 250 hp

name: Pump, centrifugal, 2 stage, 3600 rpm, HSC

name: Pump, centrifugal, 2+ stage, 1800 rpm, HSC
note: Includes drive but not motor; flow rate 100–1500 gpm, pump head 650–3200 ft, max motor power 1450 hp

name: Pump, external gear
note: Includes base plate and driver coupling but not motor

name: Pump, reciprocating plunger
note: Includes V-belt drive but not motor

size_unit: Power, hp (see note to calculate for pump)
name: Electric motor, 3600 rpm
note: Determine electric motor power requirement for pumps using P = (pump brake power)/(motor efficiency), where pump brake power = [(flow rate, gpm)*(pump head, ft)*(fluid density, lb/gal)]/[33,000*(pump efficiency)] and pump efficiency = [-0.316 + 0.24015*ln(flow rate, gpm) – 0.01199*(ln(flow rate, gpm))^2] for 50–5000 gpm and motor efficiency = [0.80 + 0.0319*ln(pump brake power) –0.00182*(ln(pump brake power))^2] for 1–1500 hp pump brake power.

size_unit: Power, hp (see note to calculate for pump)
name: Electric motor, 1800 rpm
note: Determine electric motor power requirement for pumps using P = (pump brake power)/(motor efficiency), where pump brake power = [(flow rate, gpm)*(pump head, ft)*(fluid density, lb/gal)]/[33,000*(pump efficiency)] and pump efficiency = [-0.316 + 0.24015*ln(flow rate, gpm) – 0.01199*(ln(flow rate, gpm))^2] for 50–5000 gpm and motor efficiency = [0.80 + 0.0319*ln(pump brake power) –0.00182*(ln(pump brake power))^2] for 1–1500 hp pump brake power.

name: Feeder, vibratory
note: Does not include motor or drive

name: Conveyor, belt (see note)
note: 14–60 in., up to 300 ft; does not include motor or drive; power required = 0.00058*(length, ft)*(solids flow rate, lb/s)^0.82

name: Conveyor, screw (see note)
note: 6–20 in., up to 300 ft; does not include motor, drive, lid, or jacket; power required = 0.0146*(length, ft)*(solids flow rate, lb/s)^0.85

name: Conveyor, vibratory (see note)
note: 12–36 in., up to 100 ft; does not include motor or drive

name: Bucket elevator (see note)
note: 6–20 in., 15–150 ft; does not include motor or drive; power required = 0.02*(solids flow rate, lb/s)*(length, ft)^0.63

name: Pneumatic conveyor (see note)
note: 3–30 lb/s, 30–600 ft; includes blower, motor, piping, rotary valve, and cyclone; power required = 10*(solids flow rate, lb/s)^0.95
